data.title: An Original Handwritten Letter Signed by Major General Alexander Cambridge, 1st Earl of Athlone by Major General Alexander Cambridge SIGNED: (1903) First Edition, Signed by Author(s) Manuscript /
data.meta_description: Signed by Author(s) - First Edition - Paper - UK - 1903 - Condition: Good - An Original Handwritten Letter Signed by Major General Alexander Cambridge, 1st Earl of Athlone. Dated 1903. A letter apologising for missing the opportunity to meet up. Major General Alexander Cambridge, 1st Earl of Athlone (Alexander Augustus Frederick William Alfred George; born Prince Alexander of Teck; 1874-1957, was a British Army commander and major-general who served as Governor-General of the Union of South Africa and as Governor General of Canada. Size is 180mm x 115mm. Condition is good. Light folding crease. More images can be taken upon request. Ref17705 - An Original Handwritten Letter Signed by Major General Alexander Cambridge, 1st Earl of Athlone
data.text:
Terms of Sale:

Postage, packing and insurance are extra at cost. Books may be returned within ten days of receipt if found to be not as described, providing the books are returned adequately packaged and in the same condition as received. I recommend that all returned books are sent by a tracked and signed for postal service as any losses or damage during transit are the responsibility of the sender. Postage return refunds will be at the same postal price as when shipped. Please notify us prior to returning an...

More Information

Shipping Terms:

Orders usually shipped within 2 business days. Shipping costs are based on books weighing 2.2 LB, or 1 KG. If your book order is heavy or oversized, we may contact you to let you know if extra shipping is required.

All overseas orders with priority shipping (8 days+) will be sent by either tracked airsure or international signed for. The slower postal rates (14 days +) will be sent by standard airmail and will take longer to arrive. We recommend to all our customers to use the priority shipping as this is a much quicker and secure method of shipment.

All books where possible will be sent in wrap around cardboard boxes and bubble wrapped.
